snippet: Diana Reed received a series of steroid injections to alleviate her neck pain. She later died, one of more than 130 people to have contracted meningitis in a national outbreak.
abstract: Twelve people have died so far and more than 130 have become ill in meningitis outbreak related to spinal injections of tainted steroid produced by Massachusetts pharmacy New England Compounding Center; family members struggle with the question of why better safeguards were not in place to protect their loved ones.

byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting from Boston.

lead_paragraph: Diana Reed received a series of steroid injections to alleviate her neck pain. She later died, one of more than 130 people to have contracted meningitis in a national outbreak.

headline.main: After a Meningitis Death, Family Members Ask Why
headline.print_headline: After a Meningitis Death, Loved Ones Ask Why
